pli-tv-kd15:29.3.21.comm: That is, seven or eight fingerbreadths. For a discussion of the aṅgula, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū gihinivatthaṃ nivāsenti—
pli-tv-kd15:29.4.1.eng: At this time the monks from the group of six wore their sarongs like householders—

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.2.eng: in the elephant-trunk style, the fish-tail style, the four-corner style, the palm-leaf style, and the hundred-fold style.

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.4.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.6.eng: “You shouldn’t wear your sarong like householders—

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.7.eng: in the elephant-trunk style, the fish-tail style, the four-corner style, the palm-leaf style, or the hundred-fold style.

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.9.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū gihipārutaṃ pārupanti.
pli-tv-kd15:29.4.9.eng: The monks from the group of six wore their upper robes like householders.
pli-tv-kd15:29.4.9.comm: The context provided by the previous rule on sarongs suggests that this rule concerns the style of dressing rather than the kind of robe used.

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.11.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.13.eng: “You shouldn’t wear your upper robe like householders.

pli-tv-kd15:29.4.14.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:29.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saṃvelliyaṃ nivāsenti.
pli-tv-kd15:29.5.1.eng: The monks from the group of six wore their sarongs like loin cloths.

pli-tv-kd15:29.5.5.eng: “You shouldn’t wear your sarong like a loin cloth.

pli-tv-kd15:29.5.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:30.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ubhatokājaṃ haranti.
pli-tv-kd15:30.1.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six used carrying poles with loads on both ends.

pli-tv-kd15:30.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t use a carrying pole with loads on both ends.

pli-tv-kd15:30.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd15:30.1.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ekatokājaṃ antarākājaṃ sīsabhāraṃ khandhabhāraṃ kaṭibhāraṃ olambakan”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:30.1.7.eng: I allow a carrying pole with a load on one end, a two-person carrying pole with a load in the middle, loads for the head, loads for the shoulder, loads for the hip, and hanging loads.”

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dantakaṭṭhaṃ na khādanti.
pli-tv-kd15:31.1.1.eng: At that time there were monks who did not clean their teeth.

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.2.eng: As a result, they had bad breath.

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.4.eng: “There are these five drawbacks to not cleaning your teeth:

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.5.pli: Acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattamassa nacchādeti—
pli-tv-kd15:31.1.5.eng: it’s bad for your eyes; you get bad breath; the taste buds aren’t cleansed; bile and phlegm cover the food; you don’t enjoy the food.
pli-tv-kd15:31.1.5.comm: “It’s bad for your eyes” renders acakkhussa. Sp 4.282: Acakkhussanti cakkhūnaṁ hitaṁ na hoti; parihāniṁ janeti, “Acakkhussa: it is not beneficial for the eyes; it causes their decline.” Tooth infections can apparently affect the eyes.

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.6.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane.

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.7.eng: There are these five benefits of cleaning your teeth:

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.8.pli: Cakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ na duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ na pariyonandhati, bhattamassa chādeti—
pli-tv-kd15:31.1.8.eng: it’s good for your eyes; you don’t get bad breath; your taste buds are cleansed; bile and phlegm don’t cover the food; you enjoy the food.

pli-tv-kd15:31.1.9.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā dantakaṭṭhassa khādane.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dīghāni dantakaṭṭhāni khādanti, teheva sāmaṇeraṃ ākoṭenti.
pli-tv-kd15:31.2.1.eng: The monks from the group of six used long tooth cleaners, which they even used to smack the novices.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, aṭṭhaṅgulaparamaṃ dantakaṭṭhaṃ, na ca tena sāmaṇero ākoṭetabbo.
pli-tv-kd15:31.2.5.eng: I allow tooth cleaners that are at most thirteen centimeters long. And you shouldn’t use them to smack the novice monks.
pli-tv-kd15:31.2.5.comm: That is, eight fingerbreadths. For a discussion of the aṅgula, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno atimaṭāhakaṃ dantakaṭṭhaṃ khādantassa kaṇṭhe vilaggaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd15:31.2.7.eng: On one occasion a monk used a tooth cleaner that was too short and it got stuck in his throat.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.9.eng: “You shouldn’t use tooth cleaners that are too short.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd15:31.2.11.eng: You shouldn’t use tooth cleaners shorter than seven centimeters.”

pli-tv-kd15:32.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dāyaṃ ālimpenti.
pli-tv-kd15:32.1.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six set fire to a forest.

pli-tv-kd15:32.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t set fire to a forest.

pli-tv-kd15:32.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:32.1.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vihārā tiṇagahanā honti, davaḍāhe ḍayhamāne vihārā ḍayhanti.
pli-tv-kd15:32.1.7.eng: On one occasion the dwellings were overgrown with grass. There was a forest fire and the dwellings burned down.

pli-tv-kd15:32.1.8.pli: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyanti paṭaggiṃ dātuṃ, parittaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd15:32.1.8.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks had not lit a counterfire for protection.

pli-tv-kd15:32.1.10.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, davaḍāhe ḍayhamāne paṭaggiṃ dātuṃ, parittaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:32.1.10.eng: “When there is a forest fire, I allow you to light a counterfire for protection.”

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū rukkhaṃ abhiruhanti, rukkhā rukkhaṃ saṅkamanti.
pli-tv-kd15:32.2.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six climbed trees and then jumped between them.

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchantassa antarāmagge hatthī pariyuṭṭhāti.
pli-tv-kd15:32.2.7.eng: On one occasion a certain monk was walking on a road through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī when he was blocked by an elephant.

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.8.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu rukkhamūlaṃ upadhāvitvā kukkuccāyanto rukkhaṃ na abhiruhi.
pli-tv-kd15:32.2.8.eng: He quickly went up to a tree, but being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not climb it.

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.10.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd15:32.2.10.eng: When he arrived at Sāvatthī, he told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.11.eng: They in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd15:32.2.12.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sati karaṇīye porisaṃ rukkhaṃ abhiruhituṃ āpadāsu yāvadatthan”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:32.2.12.eng: “I allow you to climb a tree to the height of a man if there’s something to be done, or as far as you need if there’s an emergency.”
pli-tv-kd15:32.2.12.comm: For the rendering “emergency” for āpadāsu, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena yameḷakekuṭā nāma bhikkhū dve bhātikā honti brāhmaṇajātikā kalyāṇavācā kalyāṇavākkaraṇā.
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.1.eng: At this time there were two monks called Yameḷa and Kekuṭa, brothers born into a brahmin family, who were well-spoken and had good voices.

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.2.pli: Te yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.2.eng: They went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ—

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.4.pli: “etarahi, bhante, bhikkhū nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā.
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.4.eng: “Sir, the monks now have a variety of names and come from a variety of families, castes, and households.

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.5.eng: They corrupt the word of the Buddha by using their own expressions.
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.5.comm: “Their own expressions” renders sakāya niruttiyā. Nirutti is found at Bu Pj 2:7.6.9, Bu Pj 2:7.6.19, and Bu Pj 2:7.6.30 where its contextual meaning must be “expression” or “manner of speaking” rather than “language”. If the word is used in the same way here, it follows that sakāya must refer to the particular expressions used by the monks. Using the Buddha’s own way of expression would not have been a problem. For a scholarly discussion of nirutti that supports this view, see Bryan Levman, “Sakāya niruttiyā revisited”, BEI 26–27 (2008–2009): 33–51.

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.6.pli: Handa mayaṃ, bhante, buddhavacanaṃ chandaso āropemā”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.6.eng: Now we could give metrical form to the word of the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, evaṃ vakkhatha—
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.8.eng: “Foolish men, how can you suggest such a thing?

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.12.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.13.eng: “You shouldn’t give metrical form to the word of the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.14.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd15:33.1.15.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sakāya niruttiyā buddhavacanaṃ pariyāpuṇitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.15.eng: You should learn the word of the Buddha using its own expressions.”
pli-tv-kd15:33.1.15.comm: Sp 4.275: Sakāya niruttiyāti ettha sakā nirutti nāma sammāsambuddhena vuttappakāro māgadhiko vohāro, “Sakāya niruttiyā: here ‘own expression’ means the Māghadhan language as spoken by the fully Awakened One.” This gloss refers to this particular usage of this expression, and it does not necessarily follow that it also glosses the same expression as used immediately above.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū lokāyataṃ pariyāpuṇanti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were studying cosmological theory.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.1.comm: “Cosmological theory” renders lokāyata. At SN 12.48:2.2 we have: Sabbamatthī’ti kho, brāhmaṇa, jeṭṭhametaṁ lokāyataṁ … Sabbaṁ natthī’ti kho, brāhmaṇa, dutiyametaṁ lokāyataṁ … Sabbamekatta’nti kho, brāhmaṇa, tatiyametaṁ lokāyataṁ … Sabbaṁ puthutta’nti kho, brāhmaṇa, catutthametaṁ lokāyataṁ, “‘Everything exists’ is the oldest cosmological theory … ‘Nothing exists’ is the second oldest cosmological theory … ‘Everything is one’ is the third oldest cosmological theory … ‘Everything is diversity’ is the fourth oldest cosmological theory.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.3.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those lay people

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.6.pli: “Api nu kho, bhikkhave, lokāyate sāradassāvī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.6.eng: “Is there any growth and fulfillment on this spiritual path, monks, for one who sees cosmological theory as the essence?”
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.6.comm: For an explanation of the rendering “spiritual path” for dhammavinaya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.8.pli: “Imasmiṃ vā pana dhammavinaye sāradassāvī lokāyataṃ pariyāpuṇeyyā”ti?
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.8.eng: “Would anyone who sees this spiritual path as the essence learn cosmological theory?”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.11.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū lokāyataṃ vācenti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.12.eng: The monks from the group of six taught cosmological theory.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.14.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.17.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.18.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇanti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.18.eng: The monks from the group of six studied worldly subjects.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.18.comm: At DN 1:1.21.1 we find a list of such worldly subjects, most prominently prognostication and the performing of rituals. At Bi Pc 49:2.1.5 “worldly subjects” is defined more broadly as anything outside of the Buddha’s teachings.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.20.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.21.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those lay people and told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.23.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.24.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū tiracchānavijjaṃ vācenti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.2.24.eng: The monks from the group of six taught worldly subjects.

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.26.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd15:33.2.29.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento khipi.
pli-tv-kd15:33.3.1.eng: On one occasion the Buddha sneezed while teaching a large gathering.

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.2.eng: The monks made an uproar, saying,

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.6.eng: Because of the noise, the teaching was interrupted.

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.7.eng: The Buddha said to the monks:

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.8.pli: “api nu kho, bhikkhave, khipite ‘jīvā’ti vutto tappaccayā jīveyya vā mareyya vā”ti?
pli-tv-kd15:33.3.8.eng: “If you say, ‘May you live long!’ to one who sneezes, will they live or die because of that?”

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.10.eng: “You shouldn’t say, ‘May you live long!’ to one who sneezes.

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.11.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.12.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā bhikkhūnaṃ khipite “jīvatha, bhante”ti vadanti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.3.12.eng: At that time when monks sneezed, people said, “May you live long, venerable!”

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.13.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not respond.

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā ‘jīvatha, bhante’ti vuccamānā nālapissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.3.15.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics not respond when spoken to like this?”

pli-tv-kd15:33.3.18.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gihīnaṃ ‘jīvatha, bhante’ti vuccamānena ‘ciraṃ jīvā’ti vattun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:33.3.18.eng: When householders say, ‘May you live long!’ I allow you to respond with similar words.”

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-kd15:34.1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was seated teaching a large gathering,

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.2.eng: there was a monk who had eaten garlic.

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.4.eng: Not to annoy the other monks,

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.5.eng: he was sitting at a distance.

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.6.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ.

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.7.eng: and asked the monks why he was sitting there.

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.8.pli: “kiṃ nu kho so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ekamantaṃ nisinno”ti?
pli-tv-kd15:34.1.8.eng: The monks told him and the Buddha said,

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.13.pli: “Api nu kho, bhikkhave, taṃ khāditabbaṃ, yaṃ khāditvā evarūpāya dhammakathāya paribāhiyo assā”ti?
pli-tv-kd15:34.1.13.eng: “Monks, should one eat anything that would stop one from hearing a teaching such as this?”

pli-tv-kd15:34.1.16.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd15:34.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato sāriputtassa udaravātābādho hoti.
pli-tv-kd15:34.2.1.eng: On one occasion Venerable Sāriputta had a stomachache.

pli-tv-kd15:34.2.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd15:34.2.2.eng: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna went to him and said,

pli-tv-kd15:34.2.3.pli: “pubbe te, āvuso sāriputta, udaravātābādho kena phāsu hotī”ti?
pli-tv-kd15:34.2.3.eng: “When you had a stomachache in the past, Sāriputta, what made you better?”

pli-tv-kd15:34.2.6.eng: “I allow you to eat garlic if you’re sick.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ārāme tahaṃ tahaṃ passāvaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.1.1.eng: At that time there were monks who urinated here and there in the monastery.

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.7.eng: It was painful to sit there while urinating.

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.8.comm: Pāduka, normally rendered as “shoe”, I here translate as “foot-stands”. This seems to be required from the context. Sp 4.290: Passāvapādukanti ettha pādukā iṭṭhakāhipi silāhipi dārūhipi kātuṁ vaṭṭati. Vaccapādukāyapi eseva nayo, “A pāduka for urinating: here it is allowable to make a pāduka of bricks, stone, or wood. The same method also applies for pāduka for defecating.” These fixtures seem more likely to be platforms or stands than shoes in any ordinary sense.

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.10.eng: The monks were embarrassed to urinate there.

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.11.eng: “I allow three kinds of encircling walls:

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.12.eng: walls of brick, stone, and wood.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.1.13.eng: Not being covered, the urine-collection pots were smelly.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ārāme tahaṃ tahaṃ vaccaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.2.1.eng: At that time there were monks who defecated here and there in the monastery.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.7.eng: The edge of the cesspit collapsed.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.8.eng: “I allow you to construct three kinds of foundations:

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.9.eng: foundations of brick, stone, and wood.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.10.eng: The cesspit was situated at a low point. It was flooded.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.11.eng: “I allow you to raise the base.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.13.eng: “I allow you to construct three kinds of raised foundations:

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.14.eng: raised foundations of brick, stone, and wood.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.15.eng: It was difficult to get up to the cesspit.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.17.eng: stairs of brick, stone, and wood.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.18.eng: People fell down while climbing the stairs.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.20.eng: When seated on the edge to defecate, they fell down.

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.21.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, santharitvā majjhe chiddaṃ katvā vaccaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.2.21.eng: “I allow you to lay a floor with a gap in the middle for defecating.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.2.22.eng: It was painful to sit there while defecating.

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.5.eng: There was no container for the wiping sticks.

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.7.eng: Not being covered, the cesspit was smelly.

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.9.pli: Ajjhokāse vaccaṃ karontā sītenapi uṇhenapi kilamanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd15:35.3.9.eng: Because they were defecating outdoors, the monks were troubled by the cold and the heat.

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.12.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, kavāṭaṃ piṭṭhasaṅghāṭaṃ udukkhalikaṃ uttarapāsakaṃ aggaḷavaṭṭiṃ kapisīsakaṃ sūcikaṃ ghaṭikaṃ tāḷacchiddaṃ āviñchanacchiddaṃ āviñchanarajjun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.3.12.eng: “I allow doors, door frames, lower hinges, upper hinges, door jambs, bolt sockets, bolts, latches, keyholes, door-pulling holes, and door-pulling ropes.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.13.eng: Grass and dust fell into the restrooms.

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.14.eng: “I allow you to firm up the structure and then to plaster it inside and outside, including:

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.15.pli: setavaṇṇaṃ kāḷavaṇṇaṃ gerukaparikammaṃ mālākammaṃ latākammaṃ makaradantakaṃ pañcapaṭikaṃ cīvaravaṃsaṃ cīvararajjun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.3.15.eng: treating with white color, black color, and red ocher; making garland patterns, creeper patterns, shark-teeth patterns, and the fivefold pattern; putting up bamboo robe racks and clotheslines.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.16.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu jarādubbalo vaccaṃ katvā vuṭṭhahanto paripatati.
pli-tv-kd15:35.3.16.eng: On one occasion a monk who was weak from old age fell over as he was getting up after defecating.

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.18.eng: “I allow suspended ropes to hold onto.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.20.eng: “I allow three kinds of encircling walls:

pli-tv-kd15:35.3.21.eng: walls of brick, stone, and wood.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.4.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, kavāṭaṃ piṭṭhasaṅghāṭaṃ udukkhalikaṃ uttarapāsakaṃ aggaḷavaṭṭiṃ kapisīsakaṃ sūcikaṃ ghaṭikaṃ tāḷacchiddaṃ āviñchanacchiddaṃ āviñchanarajjun”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.4.4.eng: “I allow doors, door frames, lower hinges, upper hinges, door jambs, bolt sockets, bolts, latches, keyholes, door-pulling holes, and door-pulling ropes.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.5.eng: Grass and dust fell into the gatehouses.

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.6.eng: “I allow you to firm up the structure and then plaster it inside and outside, including:

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.7.pli: setavaṇṇaṃ kāḷavaṇṇaṃ gerukaparikammaṃ mālākammaṃ latākammaṃ makaradantakaṃ pañcapaṭikan”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:35.4.7.eng: treating with white color, black color, and red ocher; making garland patterns, creeper patterns, shark-teeth patterns, and the fivefold pattern.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.9.eng: “I allow you to cover them with gravel.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.10.eng: They were unable to do it.

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.11.eng: “I allow you to lay paving stones.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.14.eng: There were no restroom ablution pots.

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.16.eng: There were no scoops for the ablution pots.

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.17.eng: “I allow scoops for the ablution pots.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.18.eng: It was painful to sit there while washing.

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.20.pli: Ācamanapādukā pākaṭā honti, bhikkhū hiriyanti ācametuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-kd15:35.4.20.eng: The foot stands were unenclosed. The monks were embarrassed to wash there.

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.21.eng: “I allow three kinds of encircling walls:

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.22.eng: walls of brick, stone, and wood.”

pli-tv-kd15:35.4.23.pli: Ācamanakumbhī apārutā hoti, tiṇacuṇṇehipi paṃsukehipi okiriyyati …pe…
pli-tv-kd15:35.4.23.eng: The restroom ablution pots were not covered. Grass, dust, and dirt fell into them.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.0.eng: Even more regulations on proper conduct and allowable requisites

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū evarūpaṃ anācāraṃ ācaranti—
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.1.eng: At one time the monks from the group of six were misbehaving in many ways.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.2.pli: mālāvacchaṃ ropentipi ropāpentipi, siñcantipi siñcāpentipi, ocinantipi ocināpentipi, ganthentipi ganthāpentipi, ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, mañjarikaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, vidhūtikaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, āveḷaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, uracchadaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi.
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.2.eng: They planted flowering trees, watered and plucked them, and then tied the flowers together. They made the flowers into garlands, garlands with stalks on one side and garlands with stalks on both sides. They made flower arrangements, wreaths, ornaments for the head, ornaments for the ears, and ornaments for the chest. And they had others do the same.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.3.pli: Te kulitthīnaṃ kuladhītānaṃ kulakumārīnaṃ kulasuṇhānaṃ kuladāsīnaṃ ekatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, ubhatovaṇṭikamālaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, mañjarikaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, vidhūtikaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, vaṭaṃsakaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, āveḷaṃ harantipi harāpentipi, uracchadaṃ harantipi harāpentipi.
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.3.eng: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughters-in-law, and the female slaves of respectable families.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.4.pli: Te kulitthīhi kuladhītāhi kulakumārīhi kulasuṇhāhi kuladāsīhi saddhiṃ ekabhājanepi bhuñjanti, ekathālakepi pivanti, ekāsanepi nisīdanti, ekamañcepi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, ekattharaṇapāvuraṇāpi tuvaṭṭenti, vikālepi bhuñjanti, majjampi pivanti, mālāgandhavilepanampi dhārenti, naccantipi, gāyantipi, vādentipi, lāsentipi;
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.4.eng: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, and both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.5.pli: naccantiyāpi naccanti, naccantiyāpi gāyanti, naccantiyāpi vādenti, naccantiyāpi lāsenti …pe…
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.5.eng: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing,

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.6.pli: lāsentiyāpi naccanti, lāsentiyāpi gāyanti, lāsentiyāpi vādenti, lāsentiyāpi lāsenti;

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.7.pli: aṭṭhapadepi kīḷanti, dasapadepi kīḷanti, ākāsepi kīḷanti, parihārapathepi kīḷanti, santikāyapi kīḷanti, khalikāyapi kīḷanti, ghaṭikāyapi kīḷanti, salākahatthenapi kīḷanti, akkhenapi kīḷanti, paṅgacīrenapi kīḷanti, vaṅkakenapi kīḷanti, mokkhacikāyapi kīḷanti, ciṅgulakenapi kīḷanti, pattāḷhakenapi kīḷanti, rathakenapi kīḷanti, dhanukenapi kīḷanti, akkharikāyapi kīḷanti, manesikāyapi kīḷanti, yathāvajjenapi kīḷanti;
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.7.eng: They played various games: eight-row checkers, ten-row checkers, imaginary checkers, hopscotch, pick-up-sticks, board games, tip-cat, painting with the hand, dice, leaf flutes, toy plows, somersaults, pinwheels, toy measures, toy carriages, toy bows, guessing from syllables, thought guessing, mimicking deformities.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.8.pli: hatthismimpi sikkhanti, assasmimpi sikkhanti, rathasmimpi sikkhanti, dhanusmimpi sikkhanti;
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.8.eng: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery,

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.10.pli: hatthissapi purato dhāvanti, assassapi purato dhāvanti, rathassapi purato dhāvantipi ādhāvantipi;
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.10.eng: And they ran in front of elephants, horses, and carriages, and they ran backward and forward.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.11.eng: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.12.pli: raṅgamajjhepi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-kd15:36.1.12.eng: They spread their outer robes on a stage and said to the dancing girls,

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.14.eng: and they made gestures of approval.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.15.eng: And they misbehaved in a variety of ways.

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.16.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.17.eng: “You shouldn’t engage in various kinds of misbehavior

pli-tv-kd15:36.1.18.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmante uruvelakassape pabbajite saṅghassa bahuṃ lohabhaṇḍaṃ dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-kd15:37.1.1.eng: At the time of Venerable Uruvelakassapa’s going forth, the Sangha was offered a large number of iron, wooden, and ceramic goods.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.3.pli: “kiṃ nu kho bhagavatā lohabhaṇḍaṃ anuññātaṃ, kiṃ ananuññātaṃ;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.5.eng: and ceramic goods have been allowed by the Buddha, and which not?”

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd15:37.1.7.eng: The Buddha then gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.8.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ṭhapetvā paharaṇiṃ sabbaṃ lohabhaṇḍaṃ, ṭhapetvā āsandiṃ pallaṅkaṃ dārupattaṃ dārupādukaṃ sabbaṃ dārubhaṇḍaṃ, ṭhapetvā katakañca kumbhakārikañca sabbaṃ mattikābhaṇḍan”ti.
pli-tv-kd15:37.1.8.eng: “I allow all iron goods except weapons; all wooden goods except high couches, luxurious couches, wooden almsbowls, and wooden shoes; and all ceramic goods except ceramic foot scrubbers and clay huts.”
pli-tv-kd15:37.1.8.comm: Reading kumbhakārika as an adjective, it means “that which belongs to the potter” or “of the potter”, that is, a clay hut. Sp 4.293: Kumbhakārikañcāti dhaniyasseva sabbamattikāmayakuṭi vuccati, “Dhaniya’s hut made entirely of clay is called ‘that which belongs to the potter’.”

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.9.eng: The fifth chapter on minor topics is finished.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.11.eng: “On a tree, and on a post, and against a wall,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.12.eng: On a rubbing board, rubbing hand, and with a string;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.14.eng: And old age, ordinary hand massage.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.21.eng: Sores in a mirror or bowl of water,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.32.eng: In the heat, they broke, on a bench;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.37.eng: From a peg, and on a bed, and on a bench,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.38.eng: In the lap, on a sunshade, opening.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.52.eng: And also the mound, they had difficulty;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.57.eng: Making a garland pattern, and a creeper pattern,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.85.eng: Making a garland pattern, and a creeper pattern,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.96.eng: And in the middle, clay for the face;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.116.eng: And piece of felt, should not determine;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.118.eng: They ate from one, they lay down.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.119.eng: Vaḍḍha, Bodhi, he did not step on,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.125.eng: Sunshade, and without, in a monastery,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.126.eng: Three with agreement on carrying net.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.133.eng: They trimmed beards, grew them long,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.136.eng: Mustache, would remove from private parts;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.141.eng: And clasping the knees, back-and-knee strap,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.143.eng: Multiple string belt, water snake head belt,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.144.eng: Belts of twisted strings of various colors, belts like ornamental ropes;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.145.eng: Strips of cloth, and pigs’ intestines,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.146.eng: Edges, twisted strings of various colors, ornamental ropes;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.148.eng: Also the loop at the end wore away.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.150.eng: Also should insert a shield at the edge;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.155.eng: Loin cloths, carrying poles with loads on both ends,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.157.eng: Stuck in the throat, and forest,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.162.eng: He sneezed, blessing, and he ate;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.166.eng: And they did it here and there;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.170.eng: On the edge, and painful, foot-stands;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.181.eng: Making a garland pattern, a creeper pattern,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.182.eng: A shark-teeth pattern, the fivefold pattern;

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.185.eng: And so also just a gatehouse,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.193.eng: Except high couches and luxurious couches,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.197.eng: Ceramic foot scrubbers, and clay huts,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.202.eng: If the same as the preceding,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.203.eng: Is also found in brief in the summary verses,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.204.eng: For the purpose of guiding those who have understood it.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.205.eng: Thus there are one hundred and ten topics

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.206.eng: In the chapter on minor topics in the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.207.eng: Indeed, the true Teaching will be long lived,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.208.eng: And good people will be supported.

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.209.eng: A well-trained expert in the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.210.eng: A good person intent on what’s beneficial,

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.211.eng: A wise one, lighting a lamp—

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.212.eng: This is a learned one worthy of homage.”

pli-tv-kd15:37.1.213.eng: The chapter on minor topics is finished.
